required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Percutaneous Electrolysis Versus Dry Needling in Levator Scapulae
clinical_study.official_title: Effectiveness of Ultrasound-guided Interventions of Percutaneous Electrolysis Versus Dry Needling in Levator Scapulae Active Myofascial Trigger Points

brief_summary.textblock: The objective will be to determine the effectiveness of ultrasound-guided percutaneous electrolysis versus ultrasound-guided dry needling in active myofascial trigger points of the levator scapulae muscle on pain intensity, disability and range of motion. A randomized clinical trial will be carried out. Forty patients with at least one active myofascial trigger point in the levator scapulae muscle were recruited and divided into ultrasound-guided percutaneous electrolysis (n = 20) and ultrasound-guided dry needling (n=20). Pain intensity, disability and range of motion will measured before, immediately after and 1 week after intervention.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline pain intensity immediately and at 1 week after intervention
primary_outcome.description: Neck pain intensity scores from 0 to 100 points measured by the visual analogue scale

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline pain intensity at 1 week after intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Neck disability scores measured from 0 to 50 points measured by the Neck Disability Index

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline pain intensity immediately and at 1 week after intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Neck rotation range of motion measured with an universal goniometer

intervention.description: Ultrasound-guided percutaneous electrolysis in the active myofascial trigger point of the levator scapulae muscle
Ultrasound-guided dry needling the active myofascial trigger point of the levator scapulae muscle

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Neck pain
- At least two active myofascial trigger point in the levator scapulae muscle
Exclusion Criteria:
- Systemic diseases
- Cognitive impairment
